Term.Name: Complete Main [CM]
Term.Definition: This is the main audio channel
Term.ChangeComment: Built from EBU Tech 3285 - Broadcast Wave Format

Term.Name: Music and Effects [ME]
Term.Definition: This audio channel reserved for music, including background music, and effects
Term.ChangeComment: Built from EBU Tech 3285 - Broadcast Wave Format

Term.Name: Visually Impaired [VI]
Term.Definition: This audio channel contains additional descriptive information to the attention of a visually impaired audience
Term.ChangeComment: Built from EBU Tech 3285 - Broadcast Wave Format

Term.Name: Hearing Impaired [HI]
Term.Definition: This audio channel provides louder or background noise free audio, optionally with additional descriptive information, for a hearing impaired audience
Term.ChangeComment: Built from EBU Tech 3285 - Broadcast Wave Format

Term.Name: Dialog [D]
Term.Definition: This audio channel conveys only the dialogs
Term.ChangeComment: Built from EBU Tech 3285 - Broadcast Wave Format

Term.Name: Commentary [C]
Term.Definition: This audio channel conveys an additional commentary track
Term.ChangeComment: Built from EBU Tech 3285 - Broadcast Wave Format

Term.Name: Emergency [E]
Term.Definition: This audio channel is reserved for emergency announcements
Term.ChangeComment: Built from EBU Tech 3285 - Broadcast Wave Format

Term.Name: Voice Over [VO]
Term.Definition: This audio channel conveys and additional optional voice over track
Term.ChangeComment: Built from EBU Tech 3285 - Broadcast Wave Format

Term.Name: Karaoke
Term.Definition: This audio channel is used for karaoke specific applications
Term.ChangeComment: Built from EBU Tech 3285 - Broadcast Wave Format
